hanzi-su-wiki:
齢

Значения

Возраст, годы

Мнемоника

Закономерность 令 разрушения зубов 歯 с возрастом.

Варианты

齡, 龄
purpleculture_pinyin:
líng
Japanese variant of 龄
Японский вариант возраста
rtega_mnemonic:
齡齡RS
龄龄		齢age
  • the state of one's teeth 齒/歯 and one's command 令 of oneself is an indicator of age
heisig_constituent: age, teeth, tooth, stop, footprint, rice, shovel, orders, meeting, chop-seal, hanko
heisig_story: This character is used to express the years of one's age. Its elements: teeth . . . orders.
koohiiStory1: You know you are fast approaching a ripe old AGE when you get ORDERS from the dentist to get new TEETH.
koohiiStory2: This has the nuance of a life milestone. Here it's represented by the life-cycle of teeth: In childhood, your teeth give the orders, growing whenever they want. As a teenager, we give orders to the teeth, by putting braces on them. In old age, we order new teeth!
jp_example_words: 年齢(ねんれい): age, years
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You get tooth orders. You get these tooth orders various times in your life, depending on your age.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: You get baby age tooth orders (to get your first teeth). You get child age tooth orders (to get your adult teeth). Then you get old age tooth orders (when you start loosing your teeth). There are tooth orders for every age.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Gaining and losing teeth aren't the only things dependent on age. There is also an age in which you get your first ray (れい) gun.
WaniKani_Reading_Info:
Decide what age you have to be to get your first ray gun, and then imagine getting it when you hit that age. Perhaps you use this ray gun on your teeth, to keep them clean.
Hint: when you see the radical orders it's fairly likely the reading will be れい.
Ru_Notes: Фонетик: 令 (レイ приказ). Сравни: 歳 (とし、サイ возраст).
Ru_Radicals: 个 (китайский счётный суффикс), 凵 (открытая коробка), 卩 (печать), 止 (останавливать), 米 (рис), 歯 (зуб)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: you order (令) your teeth (歯) to come at a certain age

齢
Name meaning
Nothing.
líng
яп. вм. 龄
Radicals: 歯, 令  (tooth, orders)
Meaning Mnemonic
You get tooth orders. You get these tooth orders various times in your life, depending on your age.
You get baby age tooth orders (to get your first teeth). You get child age tooth orders (to get your adult teeth). Then you get old age tooth orders (when you start loosing your teeth). There are tooth orders for every age.
Reading Mnemonic
Gaining and losing teeth aren't the only things dependent on age. There is also an age in which you get your first ray (れい) gun.
Decide what age you have to be to get your first ray gun, and then imagine getting it when you hit that age. Perhaps you use this ray gun on your teeth, to keep them clean.
Hint: when you see the radical orders it's fairly likely the reading will be れい.
